metadata.title: CVE-2021-29959 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When a user has already allowed a website to access microphone and camera,disabling camera sharing would not fully prevent the website fromre-enabling it without an additional prompt. This was only possible if thewebsite kept recording with the microphone until re-enabling the camera.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 89.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
